result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregg O. Sollman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - county ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash applied to fine - paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregg O. Sollman

records.addlTxt:
09:19 AM Defendant Gregg O. Sollman in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests case be put aside to allow time to confer with client.
09:30 AM Case is recalled with the same appearances. 
Defendant has completed community services and the anger management required by the state for the charge to be amended.

Prosecuting attorney moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court finds the defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:
$267.50 to be paid within 30 days or civil judgment entered subject to collections, as penalty for non payment of fine.
Copy of counseling report filed by Atty. Carson.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:07 AM Defendant Gregg O. Sollman in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Sydney Starr, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense has received discovery and an offer.
Defense requests time for Defendant to complete requirements to accept the offer from the State.
Charge is likely to be amended at that time.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
